result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to maintain full time employment during term of supervision.

Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  DOC to remove $250 DNA cost upon proof of previous payment.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant shall submit to random urine screenings.
No controlled substances or prescription medication without prescription from physician and in conformity with said prescription.
Defendant to have No Contact with B.A.C. (Victims mother), her residence, or her place of employment.
Defendant to have No Contact with any drug users or drug dealers.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to participate in CGIP (thinking for change) programming.
Defendant to participate in mental health treatment.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations with restitution to be paid first, followed by other court costs and financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Petition for review is denied, without costs
Defendant-appellant-petitioner's original statement in support of petition for review is accepted for filing

The judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis Stat 809.21. It is further ordered that Atty Dennis S. Schertz is relieved of further representation of Adams in this matter. It is further ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Today's hearing set for change of plea. Amended information filed. Counsel waives reading. Plea questionaire filed. Court begins to examine defendant as to a change of plea. Defendant Brian K Adams in court with attorney Jack Alan Umpleby.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is not offering any other evidence other than Dr. Pankiewicz's report as to competency. Defense has secured Dr. Nathan Glassman who concurs with Dr. Pankiewicz's report. Court finds defendant to be competent.  Jury trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.
